subject: Re: [JUnit3.8.1][Installation][OS: Win Xp Pro]
msgSnippet: Although you don t say where you installed your JUnit, I suspect that you have the same problem that I did.  I originally installed in C: Program
messageBody:
Although you don't say where you installed your JUnit, I suspect that
you have the same problem that I did. I originally installed
in "C:\Program Files\JUnit\" and got the same error no matter how I
tried to run the JUnit self-tests. Eventually, I found someone who
said that the ClassLoader has trouble with spaces in the directories
in the CLASSPATH. Trying to use "C:\Progra~1\JUnit\" wasn't any
better, but moving the entire directory to "C:\Junit\" did the
trick. I was later told that just putting quotes around the
CLASSPATH directories should be sufficient, but I never went back to
try that.

-Rob

--- In junit@y..., "jlmrodriguesfr" <jlmrodriguesfr@y...> wrote:
> I would like to know why i have this error.
>
> See below what i did and the result :
> Thanks,
>
> 1)unzip the junit.zip file
> add junit.jar to the CLASSPATH.
> 2)test the installation by using either the batch or the graphical
> TestRunner tool to run the tests that come with this release. All
> the tests should pass OK.
> 2.1 )the batch TestRunner type:
> java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
>
> result ==>
> Microsoft Windows XP [version 5.1.2600]
> (C) Copyright 1985-2001 Microsoft Corp.
>
> C:\>java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> .........................................
> .........................................
> ................F....E.................
> Time: 2,623
> There was 1 error:
> 1) testJarClassLoading(junit.tests.runner.TestCaseClassLoaderTest)
> java.lang.Clas
> sNotFoundException: junit.tests.runner.LoadedFromJar
> at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.lookupClassData
> (TestCaseClassLoader.
> java:124)
<snip/>
> FAILURES!!!
> Tests run: 119, Failures: 1, Errors: 1
